availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Patrick Donnelly (Louisville, Kentucky, molder and convict)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, molder. New York native. Son of James Donnelly and Ann Donnelly. Resident of Cincinnati, Ohio, in 1850. Convicted of manslaughter for the killing of Patrick Scott in Jefferson County, Kentucky, in January 1860. Sentenced to ten years imprisonment by the Jefferson Circuit Court on January 13, 1860. Inmate of the Kentucky State Penitentiary in Frankfort from 1861 to 1862. Pardoned by Governor Beriah Magoffin on February 2, 1861.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Ohio, Hamilton County, Cincinnati Ward 4, p. 274A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, Frankfort, p. 282.
"Police Proceedings," The Louisville Daily Journal (Louisville, KY), 28 Dec 1858, p. 3.
"Circuit Court- Criminal Term," Courier-Journal, (Louisville, KY), 16 Jan 1860, p. 3.
